title: Dragon’s Labyrinth
world_rules: Each band of levels (1–20, 21–40, 41–60, 61–120, 121–180) introduces stronger dread.
Combat weakens the player: health is scarce, victory creates vulnerability.
Companions accumulate trauma and psychological scars.
The dragon’s fall destabilizes society; later bands worsen conditions.
“The Forge” system allows redemption or second chances.
Each band includes new biomes, NPCs, and moral choices.

progression.statement: Introduce fog, pastoral decay, and hidden dread.
The world darkens; trust begins to fracture.
Trauma defines play; companions may turn on the party.
Regions are warped ecosystems; survival feels pyrrhic.
The dragon’s fall unravels the world.
